function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Mortality as a time-constant variable","Impact":"Inaccurate understanding of mortality rate and its impact on epidemic control strategies.","Mitigation":"Regularly update and verify mortality rates to reflect changing epidemic dynamics.","Technologies":"Epidemiological modeling and data analysis tools.","People":"Epidemiologists, public health officials, and researchers.","Owner":"Health authorities, research institutions."},{"Description":"Insignificant interaction effects","Impact":"Inability to account for varying effects of influencing variables on mortality, leading to less effective epidemic control.","Mitigation":"Conduct further research to understand the reasons for insignificant interaction effects and their implications for epidemic control strategies.","Technologies":"Statistical analysis software, epidemiological modeling tools.","People":"Researchers, epidemiologists, and statistical analysts.","Owner":"Research institutions, public health agencies."},{"Description":"Spatial dependency of data","Impact":"Incomplete understanding of regional spillover effects in epidemic spread, leading to inadequate spatial control measures.","Mitigation":"Analyze spatial spillover effects to identify patterns and implement targeted control measures in high-risk areas.","Technologies":"Spatial analysis tools, geographic information systems (GIS), and data visualization software.","People":"Geospatial analysts, epidemiologists, and public health officials.","Owner":"Public health agencies, research institutions."}]}
